name: Not Just Arduino
tagline: DIY Electronics group at London Hackspace
body:
### Welcome to Not Just Arduino

We are user group for people who want to learn, share and experiment electronics and microcontrollers. Our event format: Expect demo, talks, Arduino news and jam. Meetings details: Every other Monday 7pm at London Hackspace (free event, beginners and non-members welcome). 

![](https://wiki.london.hackspace.org.uk/w/images/4/4f/Njalog2.png)
### London Hackspace
We are meeting every other Monday at the [London Hackspace](london.hackspace.org.uk ), a non-profit community-run workshop where people come to share tools and knowledge.

### What should I bring?
You don't have to bring anything but if you'd like to hack/jam with us please bring your projects, development boards and components. Bringing only your question or just watching what people are doing is also completely fine.

### Do you accept beginners / non-members?
Yes! We have members of all levels and we are welcoming all to come along. Though if you're becoming a regular we'd like you to become a London Hackspace member to support the space. 

### Getting Started with Arduino
There are many development boards and ways to explore DIY electronics, Arduino is one of the easiest. We recommend to get a Starter Kit, here are a few good ones [Oomlout](http://oomlout.co.uk/products/arduino-starter-kit-ardx) and [Proto-PIC](http://proto-pic.co.uk/proto-pic-arduino-starter-kit-for-arduino-uno/) (note we're not affiliated with these suppliers in any ways.) Then you can start to follow instructions on the [Arduino](http://arduino.cc/en/Guide/HomePage) page or one of the many [tutorial sites](http://www.ladyada.net/learn/arduino/).

###  Can you help with...? 
The short answer is "maybe". Your best bet is to ask on our mailing list here. Please do at least a little bit of research before asking to help us understand better your project.

### Support or Contact
For more info about our group or projects check out our [mailing list](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/not-just-arduino) or contact [Marc](marc.barto@gmail.com).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
